newsitem.title: USA: Court orders TNP to pay bondholders $2 mln.
newsitem.headline: Court orders TNP to pay bondholders $2 mln.

text.p: A U.S. District Court has ordered TNP Enterprises Inc's Texas-New Mexico Power Co to pay $2 million in damages to holders of bonds it redeemed prior to their due date, according court records.
The U.S. District Court for the Northern District of Texas in Fort Worth issued the judgement against Texas-New Mexico Power on Monday.

The court decided for the bondholders despite Texas-New Mexico Power's attempt to invoke a clause in its bond indenture which states the debt may be called if cash is made available to the company through eminent domain proceedings.

Lawsuits followed when bonds totaling $29.2 million of a $130 million 11-1/4 percent first mortgage bond issue were redeemed on October 15, 1995 with proceeds from the sale of properties under the threat of condemnation by a local municipality. The company was first to sue as a preemptive move to support the early call, PPM said.
The court found the properties were not subjected to eminent domain proceedings, however, and said "TNP unintentionally breached the terms" of the bond.
